case_vignette: A 45-YEAR-OLD-MAN WITH A PAST MEDICAL HISTORY OF KNEE PAIN AND HYPERTENSION COMPLAINS OF DARK SPOT ON THE LOWER LIP AND HANDS THAT DEVELOP WHENEVER HE TAKES CERTAIN ORAL MEDICATIONS. HE STATES THE RASH HAS BEEN ONGOING FOR SEVERAL YEARS, AND USUALLY BEGINS AS A PINK SPOT WITH A DARKER BROWN-BLACK CENTER. HE DENIES ANY BLEEDING OR ULCERATION AT THE SITE.  CURRENT MEDICATIONS INCLUDES NAPROXEN, MULTIVITAMINS, AND METOPROLOL.   PHYSICAL EXAMINATION REVEALS A WELL DEMARCATED RED-PURPLE PATCH WITH A DARKER RED-VIOLACEOUS CENTER ON THE DORSAL HANDS AND LOWER LIP. THE PATCH IS NON-PAINFUL.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a dark spot on my lower lip and hands that usually starts as a pink spot with a darker brown-black center.
Has the size or number of the spots increased over time?
The rash has been ongoing for several years, but I didn't mention any changes in size or number over time.
Do these spots cause you any irritation or pain?
No, the spots are non-painful.
Have you had any similar spots in the past?
Yes, the rash has been ongoing for several years.
Do you have any similar spots on other parts of your body?
No, the spots are only on my lower lip and hands.
Do you have any medical conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
Yes, I have knee pain and hypertension, and my current medications include naproxen, multivitamins, and metoprolol.
Is there any family history of skin problems similar to yours?
I haven't mentioned any family history of skin problems.
Final Diagnosis: Peutz-Jeghers syndrome
